#summary Annotations Used in Piriti

= Annotations =
All mapping / serialization information in Piriti must be provided by annotations. The following annotations are available in Piriti-Core:
  * @Json: Maps a single field to some JSON data
  * @JsonMappings: Used for [ExternalMappings external mappings]
  * @Xml: Maps a single field to some XML data
  * @XmlMappings: Used for [ExternalMappings external mappings]
  
The @Json and @Xml annotations must be either placed on fields or be part of @JsonFields or @XmlMappings. @JsonFields and @XmlMappings'are class level annotations. 

Here are some examples on how to use the annotations:
{{{
public class Book
{
    @Json String isbn;
    @Json int pages;
    @Json String title;
    @Json Author author;
    @Json List<String> reviews;
    @Json List<Book> related;
    
    @Json("@.related[2].extraInfo") 
    String extraInfoOfLastRelatedBook;
}
}}}
   
{{{   
public abstract class Animal
{
    @Xml String name;
    @Xml int legs;
    @Xml double intelligence;
}
   
public class Bird extends Animal
{
    @Xml int wingspan;
}
   
@JsonMappings({@Json(property = "name"), 
    @Json(property = "legs"),
    @Json(property = "intelligence"),
    @Json(property = "wingspan"),
})
public interface BirdReader extends JsonReader<Bird>
{
    BirdJsonReader INSTANCE = GWT.create(BirdReader.class);
}
}}}
